AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court where the trial of Maria De Jesus Garcia took place, the jury deliberated, and post-verdict discovery was denied, also made oral findings of fact regarding the constitutionality of the stop and search

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: federal court reviewing the case and providing jury instructions on the importance of reaching a verdict, emphasizing individual conscientious conviction in deliberations, with prior decisions upholding the use of the modified Allen charge, also provides guidance on probable cause to search an automobile
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pena-Cantu: court case reference where the Allen charge was deemed permissible
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pacheco: court case reference that affirmed the use of the modified Allen charge

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States federal courts: courts that have historically not favored interrogations of jurors except in cases of illegal or prejudicial intrusion into the jury process
